messages: f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:45): Jonathan Harker's Journal
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:45): 3 May. Bistritz.--Left Munich at 8:35 P.M., on 1st May, arriving at
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:45): Vienna early next morning; should have arrived at 6:46, but train was
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:45): an hour late.  Buda-Pesth seems a wonderful place, from the glimpse
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:45): which I got of it from the train and the little I could walk through
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:45): the streets.  I feared to go very far from the station, as we had
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:45): arrived late and would start as near the correct time as possible.
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:45): The impression I had was that we were leaving the West and entering the
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:45): East; the most western of splendid bridges over the Danube, which is
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:45): here of noble width and depth, took us among the traditions of Turkish
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:45): We left in pretty good time, and came after nightfall to Klausenburgh.
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:45): Here I stopped for the night at the Hotel Royale.  I had for dinner,
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:45): or rather supper, a chicken done up some way with red pepper, which
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:45): was very good but thirsty.  (Mem. get recipe for Mina.) I asked the
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:45): waiter, and he said it was called "paprika hendl," and that, as it was
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:45): a national dish, I should be able to get it anywhere along the
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:45): Carpathians.
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:45): I found my smattering of German very useful here, indeed, I don't know
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:45): how I should be able to get on without it.
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:45): Having had some time at my disposal when in London, I had visited the
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:45): British Museum, and made search among the books and maps in the
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:45): library regarding Transylvania; it had struck me that some
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:45): foreknowledge of the country could hardly fail to have some importance
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:45): in dealing with a nobleman of that country.
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:45): I find that the district he named is in the extreme east of the
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:45): country, just on the borders of three states, Transylvania, Moldavia,
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:45): and Bukovina, in the midst of the Carpathian mountains; one of the
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:45): wildest and least known portions of Europe.
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:45): I was not able to light on any map or work giving the exact locality
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:46): of the Castle Dracula, as there are no maps of this country as yet to
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:46): compare with our own Ordance Survey Maps; but I found that Bistritz,
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:46): the post town named by Count Dracula, is a fairly well-known place.  I
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:46): shall enter here some of my notes, as they may refresh my memory when
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:46): I talk over my travels with Mina.
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:46): In the population of Transylvania there are four distinct
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:46): nationalities:  Saxons in the South, and mixed with them the Wallachs,
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:46): who are the descendants of the Dacians; Magyars in the West, and
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:46): Szekelys in the East and North.  I am going among the latter, who
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:46): claim to be descended from Attila and the Huns.  This may be so, for
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:46): when the Magyars conquered the country in the eleventh century they
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:46): found the Huns settled in it.
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:46): I read that every known superstition in the world is gathered into the
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:46): horseshoe of the Carpathians, as if it were the centre of some sort of
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:46): imaginative whirlpool; if so my stay may be very interesting.  (Mem.,
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:46): I must ask the Count all about them.)
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:46): I did not sleep well, though my bed was comfortable enough, for I had
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:46): all sorts of queer dreams.  There was a dog howling all night under my
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:46): window, which may have had something to do with it; or it may have
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:46): been the paprika, for I had to drink up all the water in my carafe,
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:46): and was still thirsty.  Towards morning I slept and was wakened by the
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:46): continuous knocking at my door, so I guess I must have been sleeping
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:46): soundly then.
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:47): I had for breakfast more paprika, and a sort of porridge of maize
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:47): flour which they said was "mamaliga", and egg-plant stuffed with
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:47): forcemeat, a very excellent dish, which they call "impletata". (Mem.,
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:47): get recipe for this also.)
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:47): I had to hurry breakfast, for the train started a little before eight,
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:47): or rather it ought to have done so, for after rushing to the station
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:47): at 7:30 I had to sit in the carriage for more than an hour before we
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:47): began to move.
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:47): It seems to me that the further east you go the more unpunctual are
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:47): the trains.  What ought they to be in China?
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:47): All day long we seemed to dawdle through a country which was full of
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:47): beauty of every kind.  Sometimes we saw little towns or castles on the
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:47): top of steep hills such as we see in old missals; sometimes we ran by
f60c535b2f622890ffd0a26f41c5c6e2 (18:47): rivers and streams which seemed from the wide stony mar
